groupbuilder.groupcalculator module

Group Calculator Module

This module provides the GroupCalculator class for creating and managing groups of people.

GroupCalculator(amount_people, group_size[, ...])

A calculator for creating and managing groups of people.
class groupbuilder.groupcalculator.GroupCalculator(amount_people, group_size, usable_indexes=False)[source]

Bases: GroupCalculatorInterface

A calculator for creating and managing groups of people.

This class implements the GroupCalculatorInterface and provides functionality for creating groups based on a specified amount of people and group size.

__init__(amount_people, group_size[, ...])

Initialize a new instance of the GroupCalculator class.

reset_groups()

Reset the groups and round to their initial state.

create_groups()

Creates the groups for the next round.

visualize_groups()

Print the groups in a readable format to the console.

can_repeat()

Calculates the maximum number of unique groups that can be created.

get_current_groups()

Gets the groups from the current round.

get_all_groups()

Gets all groups from all rounds.

select_from_csv_file(file_path)

Reads the CSV file and prepares the data for selection.
__init__(amount_people, group_size, usable_indexes=False)[source]

Initialize a new instance of the GroupCalculator class.

Parameters:

  • amount_people (int) – The total number of people to be divided into groups

  • group_size (int) – The size of each group

  • usable_indexes (bool, optional) – Whether to use indexing based on numbers instead of column letters, defaults to False

Raises:

  • AmountPeopleError – If the amount of people or group size is invalid

  • AmountPeopleError – If the amount of people is less than the group_size

_abc_impl = <_abc._abc_data object>
can_repeat()[source]

Calculates the maximum number of unique groups that can be created.

Returns:

The maximum number of unique rounds

Return type:

int

create_groups()[source]

Creates the groups for the next round.

Uses the algorithm to generate the next round of groups, avoiding placing the same person in the same group.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

Raises:

StopIteration – If the maximum number of rounds is reached

get_all_groups()[source]

Gets all groups from all rounds.

Returns:

A nested dictionary where the first level keys are round numbers, second level keys are group identifiers, and values are lists of people in each group

Return type:

dict

get_current_groups()[source]

Gets the groups from the current round.

Returns:

A dictionary where keys are group identifiers (column letters or indices) and values are lists of people in each group

Return type:

dict

reset_groups()[source]

Reset the groups and round to their initial state.

Creates a new GroupingAlgorithm instance with the current configuration.

Returns:

None

Return type:

None

static select_from_csv_file(file_path)[source]

Reads the CSV file and prepares the data for selection.

Deprecated since version Use: the ‘detect_csv_separator_and_load’ function from the ‘csv_read’ module instead

Parameters:

Returns:

A list of lists containing the CSV data
